data.title: Nia Long Gets Casted by Old Spice For Her First TV Commercial
data.meta_description: After joining the 'Men Have Skin Too' campaign, the performer tells Adweek what finally brought her to advertising 35 years into her career
data.text:
In 2019, Old Spice launched “Men Have Skin Too,” an episodic campaign following a couple that shares a love for Old Spice’s line of moisturizing products. Starring comedians Deon Cole (Black-ish) and Gabrielle Dennis (A Black Lady Sketch Show), the spots feature a husband who is unable to hold onto his favorite Old Spice items due to his wife’s tendency to “borrow” them. Her boundary-crossing habits have fueled an expanded universe that has seen multiple short films and major supporting stars, like Patti LaBelle as the equally overstepping mother-in-law.

The campaign’s latest installment sends the embattled couple to therapy, where they explore their issues with a mental health professional played by actress Nia Long.
